channel.title: What a shame
channel.description:
Ever since kaitnieks closed off, the cheating scene has constantly went down hill, less and less cooperation, and more and more fighting.
Very serious question. How is anything related to RS cheating now days even remotely considered being a community?
I would recommend Mopar to start cleaning house and setting examples, but afraid he would not have many people left after doing so. Honestly I expect to get flamed, ridiculed or whatever, but that would just be proving my point further.
For anyone thinking I am out of my mind, or just taking pot shots here. Go back and read through threads from when this site started to really become large up to today.

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:1, topic:222936”]Ever since kaitnieks closed off, the cheating scene has constantly went down hill, less and less cooperation, and more and more fighting.

Very serious question. How is anything related to RS cheating now days even remotely considered being a community?

I would recommend Mopar to start cleaning house and setting examples, but afraid he would not have many people left after doing so.
Honestly I expect to get flamed, ridiculed or whatever, but that would just be proving my point further.

For anyone thinking I am out of my mind, or just taking pot shots here. Go back and read through threads from when this site started to really become large up to today.[/quote]

I disagree with you. RuneScape Cheating has not been going down hill. At least, not when I look at SRL. (I don’t really read posts on mopar except this section, so I can’t tell what happens on mopar)
SRL has lots of talented and active members, as well as a lot of leechers (it isn’t really a bad thing). When Jagex sort of killed Real World Trading, all the RuneScape cheating communities got a big blow, but that isn’t that strange now is it?
SRL works quite good on SRL, and the SRL Developers cooperate fine. There are also some SRL Members cooperating together, making nice scripts.
Just my view, I don’t visit communities other than SRL often, so I can’t accurately provide my opinion on those. I just think SRL is doing a nice job, but might need to focus on other games, too. (That would be a good improvement)
A problem is the lack of Open Source applications, which are a typical example of cooperation. But some people just can’t cooperate, or are ashamed of their own code.

Read full topic

item.description:
@frank wrote:

[14:18] * Now talking in #mopar [14:18] * Topic is 'Moparisthebest.com irc channel | #vhost for your vhosts | #Moparscape for private server related talk | Ban all iPhone lovers | No mass highlighting or spamming else ban!! | http://jews.servebeer.com/paste/ | http://www.craigslist.org/about/best/orl/740493470.html | []' [14:18] * Set by sppt on Tue Aug 05 06:07:41 [14:18] * Nintendo sets mode: +o frank_ [14:18] <@frank_> RAGE RAGE RAGE RAGE RAGE [14:19] <&Lothy> frank_: [14:19] <&Lothy> you gave rictoo 29 rep [14:19] <@frank_> please remove it all [14:19] <&Lothy> dis is how he received access to the big high section [14:19] <&Lothy> frank_: can't [14:19] <@frank_> why not [14:19] owned [14:19] hi Rictoo [14:19] <&Lothy> well, can, but won't [14:19] <&Lothy> :P [14:20] * Rictoo (lolhow@1.3.3.7) Quit (Ping timeout) [14:20] <&Lothy> honestly, you're like a 14yr old girl that gets preggers [14:20] <&Lothy> she wants the problem to disappear, but she's ultimately at fault [14:20] <@frank_> im obviously schizophrenic, please add -rep so i can undo silly actions [14:20] <&Lothy> hahaha [14:20] rifk frank_ [14:20] u gave like [14:20] 999 rep to a shitload of ppl [14:21] yep [14:21] for lulz [14:21] reported u all for rep abuse..

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:1, topic:222936”]Ever since kaitnieks closed off, the cheating scene has constantly went down hill, less and less cooperation, and more and more fighting.

Very serious question. How is anything related to RS cheating now days even remotely considered being a community?

I would recommend Mopar to start cleaning house and setting examples, but afraid he would not have many people left after doing so.
Honestly I expect to get flamed, ridiculed or whatever, but that would just be proving my point further.

For anyone thinking I am out of my mind, or just taking pot shots here. Go back and read through threads from when this site started to really become large up to today.[/quote]

IMHO, It is all a matter of leadership, clear rules, getting the right people and creating consensus. Though many of you look down on SRL, it is still very much a community driven with only one thing in mind; beating the RS-system. It is not a community that takes care of life, universe and the rest…its all about RS.

Read full topic

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

My post was more about the “community” in general, not actually about cheating in RS. Sorry if I did not make that clear.

I mean, talk about what you want. I do not care lol, just making sure my point behind the posting of the thread was clear.

The reason for less cheating etc… has nothing to do with why its so much of a free for all (IE attacks in general, attacks = posting not DDOS) and fighting stuff going on in the communities between people.

Read full topic

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:18, topic:222936”]It’s just getting harder to motivate new people to actually learn anything, they just want us to make them noob-proof cheats so they just have to press a button, getting them to learn how to make them themselves becomes increasingly harder for some reason… They seem to be less motivated than in the past… Because of that our ranks grown slimmer as most of us have been around for a long time and some of us just leave because they’re tired of it…

The question is… What do we do to change that?[/quote]
Grab a shotgun, and let’s begin!

Read full topic

The question is… What do we do to change that?

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Lothy:

But there is little reason for any fresh blood to start cheating. The incentive for many to begin in the first place was money, something which is now extremely hard to transfer from account to account in any reasonable sum

Actually, that was never the original reason, just a side effect.

Way back when, the cheating community was stronger than now, and there was barely any RWT because there was no market for rs gp. People still cheated.

People like having high level characters, for a start.

Read full topic

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:15, topic:222936”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=292818.msg2359115#msg2359115 date=1217484466]

Fuck off, retard.

l0olz

Out of a global mod, I don’t have to wonder why MITB would get DDOS attacks.
[/quote]/sigh

Everyone likes to kill my buzz, don’t they?
Sheesh… ;))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))

He does have a point though.

In any case, I think anyone would be a fool to disagree with Thug Life’s post. Sure, experienced cheaters may continue with cheating as a pastime, among other things.
But there is little reason for any fresh blood to start cheating. The incentive for many to begin in the first place was money, something which is now extremely hard to transfer from account to account in any reasonable sum (which also makes selling for real-world currency difficult or unfeasible).

Another possible incentive was leveling, but given the rate at which accounts are caught it’s no longer wise to expect a high-leveled account to be produced through botting.[/quote]
accounts are caught because the cheats suck… but being as rwt has been destroyed Id assume thats the reason most would bother cheating in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: What a shame
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:14, topic:222936”][quote author=Nerice link=topic=292818.msg2359089#msg2359089 date=1217481799]

Fuck off, retard.

l0olz

Out of a global mod, I don’t have to wonder why MITB would get DDOS attacks.
[/quote]/sigh

Everyone likes to kill my buzz, don’t they?
Sheesh… ;))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))[/quote]
He does have a point though.

In any case, I think anyone would be a fool to disagree with Thug Life’s post. Sure, experienced cheaters may continue with cheating as a pastime, among other things.
But there is little reason for any fresh blood to start cheating. The incentive for many to begin in the first place was money, something which is now extremely hard to transfer from account to account in any reasonable sum (which also makes selling for real-world currency difficult or unfeasible).

Another possible incentive was leveling, but given the rate at which accounts are caught it’s no longer wise to expect a high-leveled account to be produced through botting.

Read full topic
